ygData.subject: Memory and Module Problems
ygData.msgSnippet: I have been working on a programming project that involves Heritrix and have run into some unexpected issues: 1.  I attempted to create a new processor module

From: Xavid <xavid@...>
Subject: Memory and Module Problems
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=185498048
X-Yahoo-Profile: chi2vid

I have been working on a programming project that involves Heritrix and 
have run into some unexpected issues:

1.  I attempted to create a new processor module that would send files 
over HTTP POST to a server instead of writing them to ARC files.  The 
module seems to work, but it did not appear in the menus in the web UI. 
  I attempted to fix this by adding the module to the end of the 
processors.options file.  When I create a job based on the default 
profile and add my processor, it works fine.  However, for some reason, 
when I create a profile that uses my new processor and base a job on 
it, it drops my processor and the postprocessors (basically, truncating 
the list of processors where mine should be).  Does anyone know why it 
would do this?

2.  When running a crawl, the program tends to run out of memory after 
about 0.25M URIs have been crawled.  I want the program to be able to 
run large crawls on 0.5 GB of RAM, and the less memory used the better. 
  Another programmer suggested using database software such as BerkDB 
(http://www.sleepycat.com/products/je.shtml) to act as a sort of 
virtual memory (storing crawl data on disk instead of in memory).  Is 
this feasible?  Is there something else I can do to conserve memory on 
large crawls?

Thank you very much for your assistance.
Xavid Pretzer
